course_title: Special Studies: 19th/20th Century Art/Architecture: Cézanne and Art History
class_notes: Unique within the history of art, Paul Cézanne's art has been subject to nearly every variety of art historical method, including formalism, psychoanalysis, iconology, gender, race, connoisseurship, social history, philosophy, semiotics, and deconstruction. This discussion based course examines the various and conflicting ways in which his art has been understood over time. The course serves two basic aims: to provide an introduction to the methods of art history and to introduce one of the most influential artists of all time.
course_description: Possible topics include Post-Impressionism and its consequences; Matisse & Picasso; Art and Politics between the Wars; Dada and Surrealism; the Avant-Garde; Abstract Art; What is Art?; Theories of Modernism. May be repeated for credit when topic changes, up to a maximum of twelve hours.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5665, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: T. Cronan, Status: Closed
